response.content:
Hi Burak. Sorry you felt that way. However I don't think it's fair enough. Did you watch all lectures or just skip some? I believe I have explained the theory as well as the codes quite carefully. Also, keep in mind that this is a gRPC course, not a "Golang/Java for beginner" course, so I cannot explain each and every line of code, but just focus on the main idea and gRPC itself.
Anyway, thanks for your feedback, and I hope you can give it another try.

results.content:
Great course! It covers not only the basic theory and implementation but also provides many deep and advanced features of gRPC.
I like how the hands-on lectures are taught by implementing a real application, production-ready and well-structured codebase with unit testing.
Coding speed is sometimes a little bit fast, but still easy to follow if you already have some coding experiences in Go/Java.
